page.title: 11 Miller's Dale Estate
page.content:
In{Miller's Dale}there is a{farmhouse} which is being made into a{pub.}It was built in the early 18th century and extended in the 19th century. The farm was sold to the{Cranbury Park {Estate}at the same time as Ford Farm and now looks desolate in the{Miller's {Dale}housing development. It is now a grade 2 listed building. In the 1920's a{secret room}was discovered and a lace glove was found. It was dated as about 300 years old.
The houses on Miller's Dale are nice because the gardens are looked after very well and the roads are smooth. At the beginning of each road there are bumps to stop cars going fast.
There is a Community Centre, a Doctor's Surgery and a Nature Reserve with a river going through it.
